CatDescriptText: Mr. Claude C. Slater, janitor, 3423 Webster Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "The Southern Democrats, quite a number of Northern Democrats, and some of the Republicans."
TitMainTitle: Double exposure: Portrait of Claude C. Slater wearing light colored button down collared shirt with rolled up sleeves and breast pocket, face double exposed with face of man wearing eyeglasses, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
